subsection.name: Add repository
subsection.p:
Add the Hippo Maven 2 Forge Repository to the repositories section of the root pom, if not there already.
<repositories> <repository> <id>Hippo Maven 2 Forge Repository</id> <url>http://http://maven.onehippo.com/maven2-forge/</url> </repository> </repositories>
Note: on Hippo 7.8 and later, be sure to use startup option -Drepo.bootstrap=true for initializing the types, see Content Bootstrap

subsection.name: Add dependencies
subsection.p:
Add the dependency to the plugin to the dependencies section of the pom of the cms. Normally the version is managed from the parent Hippo release pom (org.onehippo.cms7:hippo-cms7-release).
<dependencies> <dependency> <groupId>org.onehippo.forge</groupId> <artifactId>dashboard-document-wizard</artifactId> </dependency> </dependencies>

All dependencies of the plugin are declared as provided, so you have to make sure that you have these dependencies declared as well. This plugin has the Selections plugin as dependency.
<dependencies> <dependency> <groupId>org.onehippo.forge.selectionplugins</groupId> <artifactId>selectionplugins-addon-repository</artifactId> </dependency> <dependency> <groupId>org.onehippo.forge.selectionplugins</groupId> <artifactId>selectionplugins-addon-cms</artifactId> </dependency> </dependencies>
The cms is now ready to configure some dashboard shortcuts.
